o3-2025-04-16.patternDescription: Cut out the smallest rectangle that covers every non-background emoji, then turn any background squares that fall inside that rectangle into empty squares.
o3-2025-04-16.solvingStrategy: 1. (Think in numbers first) Find which colour is the background: it is the one that fills almost the whole picture (the ‚úÖ emoji, number 1).  2. Look at every square that is NOT that colour.  3. Draw the tightest possible rectangle that encloses all of those interesting squares.  4. Copy just that rectangle into a brand-new grid.  5. While copying, keep the interesting colours exactly the same (üëΩ stays 2, üë§ stays 3, etc.). 6. Any old background squares that happen to lie inside the rectangle are not copied as ‚úÖ; instead they become ‚¨õ (the 0 emoji ‚Äì ‚Äúnothing‚Äù).  7. The tiny cleaned-up rectangle is the answer grid.
hints: Treat the most common colour (‚úÖ) as background noise.
Locate the top-most, bottom-most, left-most and right-most non-background squares ‚Äì that gives you the bounding box.
Inside the box, replace leftover background cells with ‚¨õ so the box only shows what matters.

gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18.patternDescription: The solution involves identifying and extracting groups of numbers based on their relationships in the grid, focusing on how different numbers relate to each other spatially.
gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18.solvingStrategy: 1. Look for clusters of numbers in the grid. 2. Identify which numbers are adjacent to each other. 3. Find the unique numbers that appear in those clusters. 4. Count how many times each unique number appears in those clusters. 5. Create a new grid that represents these counts for the relevant areas. If you need to switch to thinking of the puzzle as numbers, remember that each number corresponds to an emoji based on the provided mapping.
hints: Look for patterns where the numbers change in proximity.
Focus on how adjacent numbers might influence each other.
Count only the relevant numbers in specific areas of the grid.
gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18.alienMeaning: The aliens might be trying to convey a message about cooperation and interconnectedness, suggesting that relationships matter, and that we need to pay attention to how we relate to each other.
